title: unicorn_(karmatron)
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] [[mexico|Mexican]] [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] comic series from the 80s.

[b]Unicorn[/b] is a sentient transformable [[alien]] robot who is a member of the [i]Transformables[/i], a group of brave and powerful transformers who were created by prince [[Zacek]] to protect planet [[Zuyua]] and the Zuyua people.

Unicorn's body is yellow, green and silver; he has a very powerful arm cannon on its left arm unit and a spiked mace on its right hand unit, as well as a potent diamond driller on the top of his head unit (hence the name). His alternate mode is an advanced combat subterranean vehicle.
 
Unicorn is one of the strongest Transformables and serves as the weapons and combat expert of the group.

title: camellia
body:
A flower growing in evergreen shrubs native to Asia, especially in Japan, China, and Korea.

In art, these flowers are usually red, but sometimes white or pink. They have a bright yellow center that sticks up and often only have a single layer of petals. They grow on a bush, though they are more often seen as cut flowers.

The actual flower has more differences between varieties, particularly in the number of petals, but the "Camellia Japonica" variety is the one most commonly seen in anime-centric art.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Camellia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camellia

title: dry_suit
body:
A dry suit is a [[diving suit]] similar to a [[jumpsuit]] designed to protect the wearer from exposure underwater. 

In contrast to a [[wetsuit]], which allows water through, a dry suit is meant to maintain a watertight environment for the wearer. As such, a dry suit is baggier and is often not skin-tight. It insulates the wearer better than a wetsuit and so is more suitable for cold or deep water, not so much for beach recreation.

title: christmas_stocking
body:
An empty sock or sock-shaped bag hung on [[Christmas]] Eve so that [[Santa Claus|Santa]] can fill it with gifts, according to tradition. It is usually a comically large red sock with white [[fur trim]].

This tag refers to the Christmas prop that is [b]not[/b] worn like a piece of clothing.

h4.See also

* [[gift bag]]

h4. External link

"Wikipedia: Christmas stocking":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas_stocking]

title: gift_bag
body:
Either a small [[bag]] made out of fabric that is tied at the top with a ribbon, or a colored paper bag with stringed loops at the top for holding. The bag will contain a [[gift]] for one person to give to another as a surprise.

Don't confuse this with a [[sack]], often associated with [[Christmas]] and [[Santa Claus]]. A sack is one large bag that can carry multiple wrapped gifts, whereas this is a single bag with a gift inside it. An example with both a gift bag and a sack clearly present is post #374610.

h4.See also

* [[gift box]]
* [[Christmas stocking]]

title: standard_diving_dress
body:
The standard diving dress is a type of [[diving suit]] which incorporates a hard copper [[diving helmet]] and a [[dry suit]], oftentimes including an [[oxygen tank]] and [[gloves]]. It was specifically designed to be used for deep water work which required the user to be underwater for long periods of time.

Note that the helmet of the standard diving dress is specifically made of metal and leaves only a small porthole to see through, often obscuring the diver's face. If the [[diving helmet]] is a glass dome, such as in post #5849345, do not include this tag.

title: power_rack
body: A power rack, also called a squat rack, is a piece of [[weightlifting]] equipment designed to be used as a mechanical spotter for free weight [[barbell]] exercises, most often [[squatting|squats]]. The most common design is of four vertical bars in the shape of an upright rectangle with two lower bars, called the bar catches, connecting two of them near the bottom to catch a falling barbell. An alternative design uses only two vertical bars, but maintains the two bar catches. Most often found in [[gym]]s.

title: chicken-mushroom_skewer_(genshin_impact)
body:
Chicken-Mushroom Skewer is a food item that the player can cook. The recipe for Chicken-Mushroom Skewer is available from the start of the game.

Depending on the quality, Chicken-Mushroom Skewer restores 8/9/10% of Max HP and an additional 800/1,000/1,200 HP to the target character. Like most foods, this can not target other players' characters in Co-Op Mode.

When Kaeya cooks Chicken-Mushroom Skewer, there is a chance Fruity Skewers will be created instead.

title: chuugoku_usagi
body:
A side character in the role of one of [[Touhoku Zunko]]'s classmates, [[Chuugoku Usagi]] is a fellow representative character for the Touhoku region developed by SSS LLC. She is a [[miko]] with a [[hakama skirt]] and [[jingle bell]]s [[hair bell|in her hair]]. She has the ability to turn anyone's clothes into sand just by looking at them, but because it can be too powerful, she carries a [[stuffed rabbit]] around with her that allows her to control her power. Although she had an [[UTAU]] singing voicebank release in 2017, Usagi finally received an updated talking voicebank in the [[VOICEVOX]] engine on May 27, 2023. Her voice provider is Momokawa Rika (桃河りか).

h4. Official Links
* "Official Site":[https://zunko.jp/]

title: inception
body:
<quote>We can go deeper...</quote>

A 2010 critically and commercially acclaimed American/British science fiction action film starring [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] as [[Dominic Cobb]], a professional thief who steals information by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets. DiCaprio is accompanied by an ensemble cast including Ken Watanabe, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Marion Cotillard, Elliot Page, Tom Hardy, Dileep Rao, Cillian Murphy, Tom Berenger, and Michael Caine. The film won four Academy Awards for Best Cinematography, Best Sound Editing, Best Sound Mixing, and Best Visual Effects.

title: tasc-01-scf_logan
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]TASC-01-SCF "Logan"[/b] is a small, fast and agile aerospace variable mecha used by the [[TASC]] to defend [[planet Glorie]].

The Logan is armed with a triple barreled ion cannon on its nose and a small energy [[gunpod]]. It can also carry a limited amount of [[missile]]s. Standard units are painted blue while ace units are painted golden and orange.

Its mecha form resembles a [[VF-1]] [[variable fighter]] from [[Macross]] in [[Gerwalk]] mode.

The Logan is [[TASC]] ace [[pilot]] [[Mary Angel]]'s mecha of choice.

title: vyland_(fire_emblem)
body: Playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and The Blade of Light]]. Member of the Coyote’s Men. Gained slight notoriety in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] for his art in that game (post #6406369), which depicts him with a [[blank stare]].

title: mary_angel
body:
A main character from [[choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross|The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

[b]Mary Angel[/b] is a member of the [[TASC]] (Tactics Armored Space Corps), an aerospace combat unit used for defense of the human colonies from [[planet Glorie]].

She is a very professional (and somewhat arrogant) mecha fighter ace. Her robots of choice are the [[tasc-01-scf_logan|Logan]] and the [[Auroran]].

Her name in the [[ROBOTECH]] western adaptation was changed to [b]Marie Crystal[/b].

Mary's character design was based in the American female rockstar "Joan Jett":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Jett .

title: rattle_drum
body:
A type of [[drum]] mounted on a stick, with two rods or beads on strings attached to the body. When rotated rapidly on its axis, the pellets fly out and strike the membranes, causing it to sound.

The Japanese version is called [i]denden daiko[/i]. It is used in religious rituals, as a noisemaker during festivals, and as a child's toy.

body:

title: he-man
body:
[i]"I HAVE THE POWER...!!!!"[/i] - [b]He-Man[/b] during the original cartoon TV series opening.

A character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] franchise. He first appeared in the original 1983 cartoon voiced by John Erwin and was later played by "Dolph Lundgren":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolph_Lundgren in the "1987 live action film adaptation of the series":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masters_of_the_Universe_(film) .

[b]He-Man[/b] is an heroic warrior who defends planet [[eternia_(planet)|Eternia]] from the evil [[Skeletor]]. He is the most powerful man in the whole universe.

[spoiler]He-Man is actually [[Prince Adam]], transformed by the power of [[Castle Grayskull]] channeled through his ancient [[Sword of Power]].[/spoiler]

title: decepticon
body:
A fictional faction of evil sentient [[alien]] [[robot]]s from the planet [[Cybertron]]. They are usually the main antagonists in the fictional universe of [[Transformers]]. 

These villainous transforming [[robot]]s can take many forms, and have many different origins and stories across the numerous different Transformers media, but in almost all incarnations, they are led by [[Megatron]]. They are typically represented by the purple facial insignia they all wear. Primarily, [b]Decepticons[/b] have red eyes, while their enemy [[Autobot]]s have blue eyes. They are usually known for their air power, especially since many of them turn into [[aircraft]]. Decepticons often turn into [[military]] vehicles, construction vehicles, and even smaller-than-human-sized objects. 

In [[Japan]]'s version of the franchise, the Decepticons are called [b]Destron[/b] or [b]Deathtron[/b] (Japanese: デストロン Desutoron). The one exception to this naming convention is Car Robots, where the sub-group referred to as "Decepticons" in the Robots in Disguise adaptation, is known in Japan as the Combatrons (the Japanese name of the G1 subgroup known as the Combaticons). The overall name of the Robots in Disguise villain faction is [b]Destronger[/b]. However, the Japanese version of Transformers Animated uses Decepticon (ディセプティコン). 

The title Decepticons is derived from the word [i]"deception"[/i] in the English language. 

h4.Known Decepticons 

* [[Megatron]] 
* [[Galvatron]] 
* [[Cyclonus]]

title: autobot
body:
A fictional faction of benevolent sentient [[alien]] [[robot]]s from the planet Cybertron. They are usually the main protagonists in the fictional universe of [[Transformers]]. 

In all but [[transformers_shattered_glass|one Transformer story]], the "Heroic [b]Autobots[/b]" are opposed by the "Evil [[Decepticon]]s", their main antagonists in Transformers. 

Both Autobots and Decepticons are sentient humanoid [[alien]] robots that can transform into machines, vehicles and other familiar mechanical objects. They are typically represented by the red facial insignia they all wear. Primarily, Autobots have blue eyes, while their enemy Decepticons have red eyes. 

Autobots often turn into regular cars, trucks, or other road vehicles but some are aircraft, military vehicles, communication devices, weapons, and cyborg animals. Some can even transform into humans; they'd be classified as pretenders. Most of the Autobot groups' names have the suffix "-bot" in them. 

In [[Japan]], the Autobots are called [b]Cybertrons[/b] (サイバトロン, Saibatoron?) except in the live-action film series and Transformers Animated, where they are referred to as Autobots (オートボット, Ōtobotto?). The [i]Maximals[/i] from Transformers: Beast Wars are also known as Cybertrons in Japan, but in North America they are called Maximals and are descendants of the Autobots. In [[Italy]], they are called [b]Autorobots[/b]. The Autobot symbol is also referred to as an "Autobrand" in issue #14 of the Marvel Comics series. 

In the Michael Bay live action films as well as in the new CGI animated series (Transformers Prime), the title Autobots is explained to be the short version of the title [b]Auto[/b]nomous Ro[b]bot[/b]ic Organism[b]s[/b].

title: laska_(less)
body:
Laska is the titular character of the story "Laska and Me," a piece of fan fiction written by Bobanon around 2014 that is loosely based on the canon of Monstergirl Encyclopedia (MGE) and also the "threadcannon" of the 4chan/jp based monstergirl threads. She is a young orphan who is adopted by the main character early in the story, and their relationship's development is the primary focus of the story. 

Her visual design is directly inspired by MGE's "Cheshire Cat" character. The most obvious difference is Laska's many scars- [spoilers]which she received from her abusive biological mother.[/spoilers]

You can read her story here: http://bobanon.pbworks.com/w/page/83050792/Laska%20and%20Me

Contrary to popular belief, Laska the character has noting to do with "less." Less was just an artist that had a fondness for her.

title: infiniti_q60
body:
A [[car]] produced by [[Infiniti (company)|]], and one of the few models that does not have a [[Nissan]]-branded equivalent. First debuted in 2013 as a rebranding of the [[nissan skyline v36|Skyline V36]]-based [[infiniti G37|G37 Coupe]], it was replaced by an original design in 2016.

The model was ultimately discontinued in 2022, and the Infiniti-original second generation was never sold in Japan during it's production.

title: matsukai_mao_(2nd_costume)
body:
The second [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Matsukai Mao]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/momoshiki/status/1398613775595446275].

It consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[collared dress]] with [[long sleeves]] a [[red ascot]] and a [[white skirt|white]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]] underneath, which is then used as the basis for either a [[maid]] costume, or a [[military uniform]], with each of its associated accessories being toggleable, allowing her to mix and match elements from both, alongside additional accessories.

The maid version adds a [[maid headdress]] and [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[waist apron]], while the military version adds a [[black headwear|black]] [[military hat]] and a [[double-breasted]] [[black capelet]] with [[epaulettes]] and an [[aiguillette]]. Both versions feature [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[black thighhighs]] with a [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[lace thighhighs|lace thighhigh]] and a garter strap on one leg and [[cat ear legwear|cat ear]]  thighhigh on the other. She also has an optional [[medical eyepatch]], [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail|tail]] and [[low wings]] [[demon wings]].

title: optical_sight
body:
Sighting device on [[weapon]]s that use optics with aligned aiming point or pattern (such as [[crosshair|reticle]] or red dot) superimposed onto the target image. Some [[gun|firearm]] designs such as the [[Steyr AUG]] and [[H&K G36|G36]] feature an integrated optical sight.

For telescopic scopes that appear larger, longer with more magnification power for sniper [[rifle]]s or DMRs, use [b][[scope]][/b] instead.

h1. Known models
* [[ACOG]]
* [[Aimpoint]]
* [[EOTech]]

body:

Early models such as the Erma EMP 34/35 and Vollmer VMP visually featured a traditional rifle-styled wooden stock, tubular [[barrel shroud]] and left-mounted magazine housing located next to the [[vertical foregrip]]. While the EMP36 was the predecessor of the famous [[MP40]].

title: enchantress_(dota)
body:
Aiushtha appears to be an innocent, carefree creature of the woods, and while this is certainly true, it is hardly the sum of her story. She well understands the suffering of the natural world. She has wandered far, and fared through forests bright and drear, in every clime and every season, gathering friends, sharing news, bringing laughter and healing wherever she goes. For in worlds wracked by war, forests are leveled for the building of ships and siege engines; and even in places of peace, the woods are stripped for the building of homes, and as fuel for countless hearths. Aiushtha hears the pleas of the small creatures, the furtive folk who need green shade and a leafy canopy to thrive. She lends her ears to those who have no other listeners. She carries their stories from the wood to the world, believing that her own good cheer is a kind of Enchantment, that can itself fulfill the promise of a verdant future.

Voiced by Gin Hammond.

title: motorola_dynatac
body:
The Motorola DynaTAC was a series of early [[cellphone]]s produced from 1983 to 1994.  They were very large and bulky compared to most later cellphones (weighing about 2.5 lbs or 1 kg) and could not fold like many later pre-smartphone models.  As such it was commonly given the nickname of a "brick phone".

title: garden_stake
body: A gardening implement used to support the fragile branches and stems of young plants from harsh weather conditions. Comes in many sizes, shapes, and materials. Also applies to the larger wooden stakes that support [[sapling]]s.

title: greenhouse
body:
A greenhouse is normally characterized by the following:

* A building largely made up out of framing and glass panels
* A building that has been made economically and with an eye for keeping costs low. 
* A building which main purpose is the growing of and the caring for plants
* Often a free-standing building not attached to other types of buildings

This is in contrast with a [[conservatory]], a building that is often confused with a greenhouse as the main purpose of a conservatory is to be used as a living space, with plants sometimes intermixed.

A few examples of a greenhouse are the following:

* A large building on a farm filled with rows and rows of plants being grown for consumption or sale.
* A small building in a private garden or "allotment garden":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allotment_(gardening)] used mainly for the growing of plants.
* A building that is of the same type of either of the two described above but is empty or used for the storage of other objects is still a greenhouse as well.
* A botanical garden can also be called a greenhouse although it often overlaps with a conservatory.

title: garden
body: A purposefully cultivated, outdoor area for the enjoyment of [[nature]] or to grow plants for human consumption. The important distinction between a garden and other nature-filled outdoor spaces is that a garden is controlled, as opposed to wildly-growing and chaotic. Not to be confused with its indoor variants, [[greenhouse]] and [[conservatory]]. h4. See also * [[garden stake]]

title: sprout
body: A young [[plant]] that has just begun its development process, typically represented by two green leaves connected to a small stem. For the [[tree]] version, see [[sapling]].

title: sapling
body:
A [[tree]] in the earliest stages of its life, usually very small and thin. If planted by humans, it may be supported by [[garden stake]]s.

Not to be confused with [[sprout]], the emerging form of non-[[tree]] plants.

title: nakano_nino
body:
A character in [[Go-toubun no Hanayome]] and second eldest of the Nakano [[quintuplets|Quintuplet]] sisters. Nino is caring and playful with her sisters, she shows a grumpy and somewhat aggressive personality to outsiders. Her best subject is English, and is also fashionable and skilled at cooking, hinting to have dreams of becoming a [[chef]]. Due to her poor eyesight, she wore contact lenses.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] (later a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]]) stylized with [[blunt bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears two [[black ribbon|black]] [[butterfly hair ornament|butterfly-themed]] [[hair ribbon]]s on each side. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open cardigan|open]] [[black cardigan]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[white thighhighs]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actress]] is [[Taketatsu Ayana]] (Japanese) and Jill Harris (English).

title: angel_(kof)
body:
Pronounced "An-hell" (as per the Spanish pronunciation of the word, therefore properly written as Ángel), a [[The King of Fighters|King of Fighters]] character who is well known for her striptease and [[large breasts|big breasts]], tied with [[Shermie (kof)|]] for the biggest bust in all of KOF at 92 cm.

In [[The King of Fighters 2001]], Angel is introduced as an agent of the secret organization known as NESTS. She is assigned to keep an eye on the experiment [[K9999]], whose purpose is to hunt down traitorous experiments that had left NESTS. During the final moments of the tournament, it is revealed that both Angel and K9999 are actually on a mission to kill [[Kula Diamond|Kula]] and her guardians.

As of [[The King of Fighters XIV]], it is revealed that Angel abandoned NESTS in its final moments and is now living for herself in [[Mexico]], though she is harrassed by NESTS agents for her betrayal. She still doesn't get along with Kula or the rest of Team K'. She forms a part of the new Team Mexico alongside [[Ramon (kof)|]] and the [[King of Dinosaurs|]].

She fights using a combination of speedy attacks and [[wrestling]] throws.

title: cantaloupe
body:
A variety of [i]Cucumis melo[/i]. A [[melon]] with sweet, orange flesh and netted rind.

Japanese art often depicts the "Yubari King":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yubari_King] cultivar with its iconic T-shaped stem.


[[Honeydew (fruit)|]] is another variety of the same species. The cross between both cantaloupe and honeydew is [[galia melon]].

title: noclip
body:
The act of clipping through objects, walls or terrain as if they are not present. Commonly seen in games as a cheating or debugging tool, see "noclip mode":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_video_game_terms#noclip_mode

Different from [[through wall]], where there is an explanation for the behavior (i.e. the subject may be a [[ghost]], there may be a hole in the wall), with [[noclip]] the existence of the clipped-through object is entirely ignored.

Not to be confused with [[glitch]], which applies to visual artifacts, not the behavior of characters or objects.

h4. See also
* [[surreal]]

title: through_wall
body:
When a character's body is stuck halfway in a wall. It could be a [[ghost]] passing through, a character stuck after trying to ram through, or a form of sexual [[restrained|restraining]].

Not to be confused with [[noclip]], where the existence of a wall is entirely ignored.

h4. See also
* [[glory hole]]
** [[glory wall]]
* [[through window]]
* [[through ground]]

title: couch
body:
A large upholstered piece of furniture designed to seat several people. Also known as a "sofa."

The smallest type of couch, one that seats two people, is referred to as a "loveseat."  A couch with a 90 degree bend in it is a "sectional couch," and as the name suggests is composed of several separate sections.

There may be some overlap between a small "loveseat" type couch and a large [[easy chair]]. When in doubt, just tag them as a couch.

[[chaise_longue|Chaise longues]] (French for "long chair") are also called couches, commonly used as the stereotypical "psychiatrist's couch."

h4. See also

* [[Bench]]
* [[Chair]]
** [[Easy Chair]]

title: flat_screen_tv
body:
A flat-screen [[television]], or more accurately a flat-panel television, is a television set with a thickness usually under 10 cm (~4 in.).  This is opposed to [[crt|cathode-ray tube televisions]] or rear-projection televisions whose designs required rather thick housing.

This tag is specifically for flat-panel tvs, which the term "flat-screen tv" is used interchangeably with today.  It should not be used for rear-projection tvs or flat-screen cathode-ray tube tvs, which were particularly common before LCD and similar technologies become the dominate technology used for televisions.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Flat-panel display":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flat-panel_display]

title: honing_steel
body:
Honing steel (sometimes referred as [i]sharpening steel[/i]) is a rod of steel, ceramic or diamond-coated steel used to restore keenness to dulled [[knife|blade]] edges. It is flat, oval, or round-shaped in cross-section. There are also non-abrasive ones with rods of smooth ceramic or ribbed steel. Some have a ring on its screwdriver-like grip.

title: koronba
body:
A retired [[UTAU]] composer who used to upload songs on [[niconico]]. Has suddenly deleted all of their videos circa 2014, but their songs maintain cult popularity to this day, to the point that covers/MADs/YTPMVs (most notably [[Iwashi ga Tsuchi Kara Haetekuru n da (utau)|]]) and tribute songs are being frequently made (some even having relatively difficult-to-search titles). They are also the creator of the [[Yume Nikki]] fangame [[LcdDem]].

Within the UTAU community, their name is generally considered a forbidden word, and is commonly known by the alias "xx".

title: ningen_shikkaku
body:
[i]Ningen Shikkaku[/i] or [i]No Longer Human[/i] is a semi-autobiographical tragedy novel written by Osamu Dazai. Considered Dazai's masterpiece, it follows the troubled life of Oba Yozo and his struggles with personal relationships, addiction, depression and suicide attempts.

Unfortunately, the novel mirrored a lot of the real life Dazai's anguish, and he committed suicide shortly after the novel's publication.

title: ginga_tetsudou_no_yoru
body: [i]Ginga Tetsudou no Yoru[/i] or [i]Night on the Galactic Railroad[/i] is a children's science fiction novel written by Kenji Miyazawa. Perhaps his most well known work, it chronicles the friendship of two characters, [[giovanni_(ginga_tetsudou_no_yoru)|Giovanni]] and [[campanella_(ginga_tetsudou_no_yoru)|Campanella]] and is commonly referenced in other forms of Japanese fiction.

title: sound_wave
body:
A visual representation of transmitted sound. This can be portrayed a couple of ways:

* Ring-like waves emanating from a person or audio source (post #2200295, post #2115595)
* A line that fluctuates in tune to a produced sound (post #3817448)

Not to be confused with the [[Transformers]] character [[Soundwave (transformers)|]], or the [[cardiogram]] which represents a heartbeat.

For water waves, use [[waves]].

title: dominator_(gun)
body:
Full name: "Dominator Portable Psychological Diagnosis and Suppression System (携帯型心理診断鎮圧執行システム、ドミネーター)" is the iconic [[handgun]] carried by Inspection and Enforcement officers of the Public Safety Bureau in [[PSYCHO-PASS]]. 

When the Dominator is aimed at a target, it continuously reads and sends psychological data ‒ the individual's Psycho-Pass ‒ which it sends to the Sibyl System for calculation of their Crime Coefficient. When this value exceeds a certain level, one indicating that the target is mentally unstable and likely to commit a violent crime, the gun will be operable. If the level does not exceed such levels, the muzzle will not open and a safety device will be activated to prevent the user from pulling the gun's trigger.

h4. External links
* "Psycho-Pass Wiki - The Dominator":[https://psychopass.fandom.com/wiki/The_Dominator]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia (Japanese) - Portable Psychological Diagnosis and Suppression System":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E6%90%BA%E5%B8%AF%E5%9E%8B%E5%BF%83%E7%90%86%E8%A8%BA%E6%96%AD%E9%8E%AE%E5%9C%A7%E5%9F%B7%E8%A1%8C%E3%82%B7%E3%82%B9%E3%83%86%E3%83%A0]

title: vf-1
body:
A notable and popular mecha from the [[MACROSS]] series. 

The [b]VF-1 Valkyrie[/b] is Earth's three-form [[variable fighter|transformable]] aerospace multi-role combat [[mecha]] developed from [[alien]] [i][[Protoculture|Overtechnology]][/i] obtained from the [[SDF-1]] "Macross" [[spacecraft]]. Its armaments include a modular [[gunpod]], [[laser]] cannons and several different types of [[missile]]s. It can be equipped with modular attachments such as [[reactive armor]] and external fuel/thruster packs.

Thanks to its FF-2001 thermonuclear engines it can fly in both an atmosphere and outer [[space]]. The VF-1 [[variable fighter]] can also transform into fighter, [[gerwalk]] and [[battroid]] (giant robot) modes.

There are several different variants of the fighter, called [[VF-1A]], [[VF-1J]], [[VF-1D]], [[VF-1S]], [[VF-1J Armored]], [[SDP-1 Stampede Valkyrie]], [[VE-1]], [[VT-1]], [[VT-1 Super]], [[VF-1 Super]] and [[VF-1 Strike]].

It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982) where it was created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight a race of humanoid alien [[giant]]s called [[Zentradi]]. It was eventually succeeded by the far more advanced [[VF-4]] [i]Lighting III[/i].

In [[real life]] the VF-1 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. The design of the mecha's fighter mode is loosely based on the [[f-14_tomcat|F-14]] combat jet and its name is a tribute to the [[XB-70]], Kawamori's favorite aircraft.

This mecha was called the [b]VF-1 Veritech[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of Macross. In that continuity the mecha was developed from alien [i][[ZOR|Robotechnology]][/i] and the term VERITECH is an acronym which stands for [b]V[/b]ariable [b]E[/b]ngineering and [b]R[/b]obotics [b]I[/b]ntegration [b]TECH[/b]nology. 

h4. See also

* [[VF-0]]
* [[VF-1EX]]

title: variable_fighter
body:
A term from the [[MACROSS]] [[science fiction]] anime franchise.

It was introduced in the first series [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] from 1982.

A [b]Variable Fighter[/b] is a [[fighter jet]] or a [[starfighter]] that can transform into a manned robot or [[mecha]].

Most of them have three modes of transformation: [[giant]] [[robot]] ([[battroid]]), [[fighter_jet|fighter]] and an in-between mode called [[gerwalk]].

In [[real life]] most of the variable fighters of the franchise (except those from [[Macross 2]]) were created by mecha designer and anime creator [[Kawamori Shouji]].

Variable fighters were renamed [b]Varitechs[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of Macross. 

h4. Some known variable fighters

* [[VF-0]]

title: mecha-fiora
body:
Alternate form of [[Fiora (xenoblade)|]] in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 1]].

She is first seen at the top of Prison Island. She later joins Shulk on the Fallen Arm as the seventh and final permanent party member, earning her the nickname "Seven" to avoid spoilers.

Similarly to her Homs form, she has [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]]. However, she is now a [[cyborg]] with [[short hair]] and wields [[dual_wielding|twin]] [[sword|swords]]. Her default "attire" is the Ether Cowling, a mechanical body that reveals no skin, but she is frequently portrayed with the [[Mecha-Fiora (Speed Cowling)| Speed Cowling]].

title: nemo_(nadia)
body:
A fictional character from [[Fushigi No Umi No Nadia]]. He is capitan of the [[submarine]] ([spoilers]and later [[spacecraft]][/spoilers]) [[Nautilus (Nadia)|]].

He is based on the classic [[science fiction]] literary character of [[Captain Nemo]] from Jules Verne's novel - [i]20,000 Leauges Under the Sea[/i].

The visual character design of Nemo was also based on that of [[Bruno J. Global]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

It is eventually revealed in the series that [spoilers]his true name is  "Eleusis La Arwall", and that he is the biological [[father and daughter|father]] of [[Nadia La Arwall|Nadia]] and the rightful ruler of Atlantis[/spoilers].

title: searchmaton_(dennou_coil)
body:
[b]Satchī[/b] (サッチー, short for "Searchmaton" サーチマトン Sāchimaton) is a bot and antivirus software deployed by the Cyberspace Administration of Daikoku. Its task is to debug and maintain the virtual side of the city. Its secondary function is to seek out and disable illegal AR devices, software, and viruses, making it a menace to the characters of the series. Searchmaton can deploy up to four spherical drones to aid in its task. While Searchmaton can patrol the city streets freely, it is prohibited to enter private property such as houses, and other spaces such as temple grounds and schools, because they lie outside of the responsibility of Daikoku's Cyberspace Administration. The protagonists utilize this and other predictable aspects of Searchmaton's behavior to escape its grasp. Searchmaton, striking terror into the hearts of children, is ironically painted with a smiley face and punctuates its violent attacks with the cute catch phrase "I'm Satchī!" (僕サッチー boku Satchī?) which [[okonogi_yuuko|Yasako's]] father had a part in developing. [[harakawa_tamako|Tamako]] often hijacks Searchmatons for use as her personal digital henchmen. They are later replaced by the upgraded Searchmaton 2.0 in the form of cubes which have upgraded weapons and shielding, and can combine like the Q-chan to perform wide area re-formatting. Since the 2.0s are under government jurisdiction they can enter areas inaccessible to Satchī including shrines, and also private property when authorised.

(Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)

title: vf-31
body:
Fictional transformable [[variable fighter]] from the [[Macross Delta]] science fiction and [[mecha]] animated television series released in 2016.

The [b]VF-31 Siegfried[/b] is the protagonist variable fighter of the new show. 

It is the mass production version of the [[YF-30]] [b]Chronos[/b] advanced prototype variable fighter that appeared in the [[Macross 30]] [[Playstation 3]] [[video game]] from 2013. However, unlike the Chronos the VF-31 has two built-in [[gunpod]]s in its arms and forward-swept wings.

In real life it was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] for the show. Not to be confused with the [i]U.S. Navy's Strike Fighter Squadron 31[/i] ("VF-31").

h4.Variants

* [[VF-31A]]
** [[VF-31AX]]

title: jeanne_francaix
body:
A fictional female main character from [[choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross|The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

[b]Jeanne Francaix[/b] is a [[blonde hair]]ed member of the [[ATAC]] ([i]Alpha Tactics Armored Corps[/i]) 15th squadron, a mechanized infantry unit used in the defense of the human colony at [[planet Glorie]].

Her [[mecha]] of choice is the ATAC [[Spartas]].

She can be a very jovial, funny, cheerful and childish character during peacetime, but also a serious capable leader and an intrepid, brave warrior during combat.

In the original series her name and character were inspired by those of legendary [[france|French]] heroine [[jeanne_d'arc|Joan of Arc]].

In the adapted, English-language [[ROBOTECH]] anime for North American audiences, this character was renamed [[Dana Sterling]].

title: rhyme
body:
A literary device in which two words are related by ending with the same sounds, commonly used in English poetry and music at the ends of lines.

In Japanese, the limited phonetic set combined with regular, shared endings for same parts of speech conjugated the same way means that rhyming is of no significance in poetry, literature, and music.

Accordingly, do not tag Japanese "rhymes" unless a character points it out or it just stands out as obviously intentional.

h4.  See also

* [[Alliteration]]

title: pindad_ss2
body:
[b]Pindad SS2[/b] is a 5.56×45mm NATO [b]Indonesian [[assault rifle]][/b], manufactured by "PT Pindad":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pindad]. Produced since 2005 and entered [[military]] service in 2006. SS2 is short for [i]Senapan Serbu 2[/i] (Assault Rifle 2).

The SS2 is an upgrade of the earlier [[FN FNC|Pindad SS1]]. Its flash suppressor is based on that of the [[M16]]A2, and it has a reciprocating charging handle that can be used for forward assist, with the front sight being based on the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]]. The carry [[handle]] and detachable rear sights on top of the Picatinny rail can be removed in order to install various [[optical sight|optics]].

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[Pindad SS3]] [tn]([[battle rifle]] variant)[/tn]
* Wikipedia entry: "Pindad SS2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pindad_SS2]

title: fn_tps
body:
The [b]FN TPS[/b] (Tactical Police Shotgun) is a [[pump action]] [B][[shotgun]][/b] designed and manufactured by [[FN Herstal]]. It is based on the earlier [[Winchester Model 1200/1300]] and uses many similar features such as the ported barrel. It has many modern features including an adjustable or A2 fixed stock, pistol grip, and MIL-STD-1913 Picatinny rail. The TPS features an [[M16A2]] style ironsights. The sights are adjustable for both elevation and windage.

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "FN TPS":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_TPS]

title: lanchester_smg
body:
The [b]Lanchester[/b] is a British 9×19mm Parabellum [[submachine gun]] manufactured by the "Sterling Armaments Company":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sterling_Armaments_Company] between 1941 and 1945. It is a copy of the German [[MP28]]/II. It was primarily used by the [[Royal Navy]] during [[World War II]], and to a lesser extent by the [[Royal Air Force]] Regiment (for airfield protection). The [[weapon]] took its name after "George Herbert Lanchester":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Lanchester], who was charged with producing the weapon at the Sterling Armaments Company.

The Lanchester had a heavy wooden buttstock, a machined-steel action and breech block, a [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] housing made from brass (later steel) and a mounting on the muzzle for use of a long-bladed 1907 [[bayonet]]. The weapon was produced in two versions, Mk.1 and Mk.1*. The Mk.1* has no fire selector (full-auto only) and has simplified iron sights.

In popular culture depiction, the Lanchester is the signature weapon of [[Mika (blue archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]]. 

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[Sten gun]]
* [[Sterling SMG]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Lanchester submachine gun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanchester_submachine_gun]

For example, on an image of [[Flandre Scarlet]]:

title: xebec
body:
Japanese animation studio. Originally owned by [[Production IG]], XEBEC was often considered a rival to [[Sunrise (company)|]] for their output of [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] series.

In 2019, the studio was acquired by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]] and ceased operations. Its address and remaining assets were reorganized into a new studio called [b]Sunrise Beyond[/b], with their first production after the acquisition being [[Gundam Build Divers Re:Rise]]. title: colonel_(mega_man)
body:
[[Mega Man X (series)|]] character.

A key player in X4. Colonel is the field commander of the Repliforce army (the actual leader, General, being too big to leave his room). He's a samurai type with more honour than sense. He and [[iris (mega man)|Iris]] are the product of an attempt to create the perfect warrior Reploid; the program couldn't be crammed into just one mind, so two very similar Reploids were made instead. They think of each other as brother and sister, and Colonel's eventual death does [i]not[/i] go over well with Iris.

Colonel is seen again in the intro to X5 and in one of Phoenix's Magnion's attacks in Zero 2. [[Colonel.exe (mega man)|His incarnation]] in the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] series is even more plot-significant.

title: marino_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Series:[/b] [[Mega Man X (series)|]]

A playable character from Command Mission. Marino is a thief, but not a Maverick; she's sort of a Robin Hood type who steals new technology so she can open-source it. She and [[X (mega man)|X]] find common cause against Epsilon's Rebellion.

Marino has [[green hair]] in an enormous curly [[ponytail]] and fights ninja-style. She has one of the game's best Hyper Modes: Quicksilver, which raises her speed so high she'll pretty much get every turn until it runs out. (It also happens to palette-swap her pants clear off.)

title: axl_(mega_man)
body:
A playable character in the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. Axl is a Reploid who defected to the Maverick Hunters from Red Alert, a rival organization that went bad. He's a brave kid with a strong sense of justice, but he's not a big thinker, and [[X (mega man)|X]] -- whose own enthusiasm wore off a few apocalypses ago -- is reluctant to let him on the front lines.

Axl likes [[dual wielding]] a pair of [[handgun]]s, but his real advantage is A Trans, an ability unique to him (at first) that lets him copy the forms of other Reploids. He also has hover-boots and gets special weapons from bosses like X does, but Axl's weapons are held rather than built in, and sometimes don't require ammo. Despite a host of [i]very[/i] strong parallels, there's no official connection between Axl and [[Model A (mega Man)|]] from the ZX games.

Axl's addition to the series in X7 was extremely controversial. He improved significantly in Command Mission and X8, but remains a fandom sore spot. He may or may not be named after Axl Rose.

title: spider_(mega_man)
body:
[b]Series:[/b] [[Mega Man X (series)|]]

A playable character from Command Mission. The first new ally [[X (mega man)|X]] makes in Giga City, Spider is a suave gambler type with a cool hat. His attacks are based on playing cards.

[spoiler]However, it may not be the real Spider you're looking at in any given picture. A while after his "death", Spider returns -- and turns out to be a disguise used by the game's main villain, Colonel Redips. We never find out whether there was a real Spider whose place Redips took, or when it happened if so.[/spoiler]
other_names: スパイダー(ロックマン)

title: rockman_online
body:
[b]Rockman Online[/b] was a Korean MMORPG computer game announced in June 2010.  It took place in the far future, where the characters from the [[Mega Man (classic)|]] and [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series had long since passed away, including the Maverick threat.

Believing the threat of Mavericks are gone for good, society is taken by surprise one day when a large number of Mavericks began to wreak havoc. In response, the UCA (United Continent Association), initiates the production of copies of [[X (mega Man)|]], [[Zero (mega man)|]], and [[Duo (mega man)|]], among other heroes, to combat the rampant Mavericks. The UCA went so far as to embed the DNA Souls of the original heroes onto a chip housed within the copy bodies to further enhance their abilities in an effort to make them as legitimate as possible. The Mavericks associated with [i]Rockman Online[/i] are actually rebuilt and heavily customized versions of enemies from the past, produced in a similar manner to the X, Zero, and Duo copies.

In March 2013, NeoWiz announced that Rockman Online was cancelled.

h4.External links
* "Mega Man Knowledge Base: Rockman Online":https://megaman.fandom.com/wiki/Rockman_Online
other_names: ロックマンオンライン

title: cinnamon_(mega_man)
body: [b]Cinnamon[/b] is a young Reploid built personally by Professor Gaudile. One of her main functions is the restoration and repair of her fellow Reploids, and thus was built with a angel-like nurse appearance. Cinnamon's personality is very reserved, and she is quite naive, treating Marino, a thief who was there to abduct her, like a potential friend, and even healing her after Marino was attacked by Dr. Psyche's Preon guards. She joins [[x (mega man)|X]]'s party willingly later on, rather than stay with Professor Gaudille, inspiring him to join the Resistance command team as well in a scientific capacity.

title: formula_drift
body:
Also known as [b]Formula D[/b], Formula Drift is a United States-based [[drifting]] championship. Because of the nature of the sport, FD events are scored by a panel of judges, similar to motocross or figure skating. As of 2013, Formula Drift began overseas expansion by introducing a Japanese championship.

[[racecar|Formula Drift vehicles]] must be rear-wheel drive (either from the factory or converted by the team's engineers), and cannot be trucks or SUVs. Popular [[car]]s for FD include the [[Nissan Silvia]]/[[nissan 180sx|180SX]] (and the US market 240SX versions), [[BMW M3]]/[[bmw m4|M4]], [[Mazda RX-7 FD]], [[Nissan Fairlady Z]], [[Toyota 86]]/[[Subaru BRZ]]/[[Scion FR-S]], [[Ford Mustang]], [[Chevrolet Corvette C6]]/[[chevrolet corvette c7|C7]], [[Dodge Viper]], and [[Nissan Skyline GT-R]].

title: blonde_haired_crossdresser_(hokuro_ryuuseigun)
body:
The unofficial name for an [[original|original character]] by [[Hokuro Ryuuseigun]]. Acquainted with [[Brown Haired Crossdresser (hokuro ryuuseigun)|]] and often acts as the [[tsukkomi]] of the pair.

title: super_robot_wars_30
body:
A [[Super Robot Wars]] game released for the series' 30th anniversary. The game was released for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[computer|PC]] in October, 2021, and has made history by being the first crossover game in the series to see a release in America and Europe.

h1. Original Characters
* [[Edge Sainklaus]]
* [[Az Sainklaus]]
* [[Caruleum Vaull]]
* [[Mitsuba Greyvalley]]
* [[Reynold Hardin]]
* [[Lian Anbird]]
* [[Irene Beclair]]
* [[Miyu Incomes]]
* [[Orchidacea]]

h1. Original Mecha
* [[Huckebein 30]]
** [[Huckebein 30th]]
* [[Gravalin]]
* [[Dreistreger]]

* [[Ultimate Dancouga]] (SRW original upgrade)

In addition to the new original characters, [[Ryuusei Date]] and [[Masaki Andoh]] from [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation]] appear as pre-order bonus guests piloting the [[SRX]] and [[Cybuster]] respectively, while [[Gilliam Yeager]] and his [[Gespenst]] were added as a free update for all players on November 17, 2021, with another free update adding [[Dido (super robot wars DD)|]] and [[Didalion]] from [[Super Robot Wars DD|DD]] on December 22, 2021. A final free update on April 20, 2022 added [[Irmgult Kazahara]] in [[Grungust Ichishiki]], as well as [[Inui Asahi]] and [[Shatte Judevesten]] in [[Van Ein]]. Several other OG characters and [[mecha]] are available through DLC, those being as follows.

It was well-received and adapted into a comedy/action film of the same name originally released in 1981. It was also adapted into a television program in 1982 and in 2006.

title: capcom_belt_action
body:
[i][b]Capcom Belt Action[/b][/i], known as [i][b]Capcom Beat ‘Em Up Bundle[/b][/i] outside Japan, is a classic [[video game]] collection published by [[Capcom]] for the [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[computer|Pc]] (Steam). 

As the title suggest, it is a bundle of beat 'em up [[arcade]] games developed by Capcom. The collection was officially announced in September 13, 2018 and was released digitally worldwide on September 18 of the same year.

title: biting_pear_of_salamanca
body:
A character originating from a surreal painting by the artist [[Ursulav]]. The painting featured a giant [[pear]] with human [[teeth]] being photographed by a small squirrel in a meadow landscape.

The picture eventually caught on with Internet users outside of its home DeviantArt due to the sheer absurdity of the concept, and the pear's slackjawed expression caused people to use it as an image macro, which lead to its moniker of the "lolwut pear".

title: bottle_cap_challenge
body:
A viral internet "challenge" where a person attempts to unscrew or uncap a [[bottle]] using a [[roundhouse kick]] without toppling the bottle over. The origin of the challenge is unclear, but the spread started when Farabi Davletchin, a Kazakh Taekwondo champion, posted a video on Instagram successfully using the roundhouse kick to uncap a bottle and then challenged celebrities to do the same (several celebrities, martial artists, and ordinary folk accepted with varying degrees of success, not necessarily with roundhouse kicks but with other techniques and/or objects).

h4. External links

* "New York Times: The Bottle Cap Challenge Spins Across the Internet":[https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/03/us/bottle-cap-challenge.html]
* "BGR: What the heck is the Bottle Cap Challenge?":[https://bgr.com/2019/07/04/what-is-the-bottle-cap-challenge/]
other_names: ボトルキャップチャレンジ

title: guru_guru_dj_turn!!
body:
Opening theme for the [[D4DJ]] First Mix anime, sung by the members of Happy Around with guest appearances from [[Yamate Kyouko]] and [[Izumo Saki]].

The animation became something of a [[meme]], as the segment where Happy Around's members take turns making [[hip hop]] hand signs at the camera went viral on TikTok and inspired a number of parodies. The viral clip replaced the original song with a remix of Playboy Carti's Magnolia by yxungixxak ("song link":[https://youtu.be/HUmDtLmn9dk])

This tag should be used for posts that feature or parody either the song or the opening animation.

h4. See Also
* "YouTube: 「D4DJ First Mix」OPENING (No Credits)":[https://youtu.be/_wcGvZuF2AE] - official upload of the anime opening 
* Post #5117066 - the segment of the animation that became a meme

title: jiji_(creature)
body:
Tag for the creature that appears in [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]'s Twitter profile photo and therefore serves as their avatar of sorts; a blue cube-like ghost creature reminiscent of the ghosts in the [[Pac-Man (game)|]] franchise. Fan art, especially ones of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i], has already turned this avatar into a character separate from the artist.

Whenever this creature appears in fan art or art by other known artists, never use "[[artist self-insert]]"; it should be used for its appearances in Jiji's own art per that tag's description. "[[Borrowed character]]" can suffice as an additional tag.

title: rehydrated_ganondorf
body:
A fan variation of [[Ganondorf]] as he appears in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i].

Originating from a "joke":https://twitter.com/furanchu/status/1138546846173843457 by Twitter user furanchu about Ganon's withered corpse being restored if water was given to him. In works depicting him circa [i][[the legend of zelda: tears of the kingdom|Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], he acts as a companion to [[Link]] and [[Princess Zelda]]. This Ganondorf retains his long [[red hair]], but wears little more than a blue [[toga]], [[loincloth]], or waist cloth. He is always depicted with his golden jewelry and headpiece. He will also often be associated with bodies of water.

Note: Pictures merely depicting Ganondorf in his youth/alive shouldn't count as a Rehydrated Ganondorf. Only ones based off of the corpse's appearance and dress should count. A tell-tale sign of a Rehydrated Ganondorf also lies in skin color; canon [i]Tears[/i] Ganondorf has [[green skin]], while most variations of Rehydrated Ganondorf will have the same [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] as the rest of the [[Gerudo]].

h4. External Links
* "Know Your Meme: Rehydrated Ganondorf":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/rehydrated-ganondorf

title: history_of_japan
body:
""history of japan":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mh5LY4Mz15o]" is a viral video, originally uploaded to YouTube in February 2016 by American artist Bill Wurtz. The video is a bizarre 9-minute-long documentary in which a (mostly) deadpan Wurtz gives a fast-paced satirical retelling of Japanese history from the ancient era all the way up to the 20th century, frequently intercut with very short melodies. In May 2017, Wurtz uploaded a similarly-formatted video with a much broader scope, called ""history of the entire world, i guess":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xuCn8ux2gbs]".

Please do not confuse this with [[Japanese mythology]].

title: sento-kun
body:
せんとくん (Sento-kun) is the official [[mascot]] character for the event being held in Nara prefecture: "Celebrating the 1300th anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital in 2010." He has the appearance of a little boy with deer antlers growing out of his head.
"Nara prefecture":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nara_Prefecture are famous for the [[deer]] that roam the parks, as well as it's many Buddhist [[temple]]s.
(Children are called "Douji" in Buddhist art and are said to have sacred power.)
When his design was first revealed to the public, it received strong criticisms, with people calling him "creepy" and "a desecration of Buddhism." On the contrary, these criticisms ironically became publicity and made him famous.
As data was released of Sento-kun being depicted as a muscular, grown-up man using 3DCG modeling software called "MikuMikuDance," he was called "せんとさん (Sento-san)" in order to differentiate him from the more child-like Sento-kun.

h4.See also

* "Celebrating the 1300th anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital Official Page":http://www.1300.jp/foreign/english/ 
* "Global Voices Online news article":http://www.globalvoicesonline.org/2008/04/22/japan-love-and-hate-story-of-the-mascot-character-sento-kun/
* Sento-san videos
** NicoNico: http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm9689081
** Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hw30eJ5jvQA

title: polar_bear_chaos
body:
白熊カオス ([i]Shiro-kuma Chaos[/i], Polar [[bear]] Chaos) is a character appearing in a Playstation 2 game called [[Kuma Uta]] (bear song)." The game was released on November 25, 2003 by SCEI.

In the game, the player writes their own lyrics to "[i]Enka[/i] songs":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enka and teaches them to a polar bear as their pupil. In other words, this game is a singing synthesizer software that was released before [[Hatsune Miku]].

The polar bear can be named to the player's liking. "Polar bear Chaos" is the "pupil" of a player named "Sabu Kitajima," made famous by [[NicoNico]] and YouTube. Fans of Chaos call him "カオス師匠 ([i]Chaos-shishou[/i], Master Chaos)." He often talks about his love for [[loli]] girls, but he most certainly says it as a joke, and it does not mean he is really a [[pedophile]]... probably.

title: obsolete
body:
Obsolete is a [[3D]] animated [[science fiction]] series directed by [[Urobuchi Gen]], featuring music by [[Skrillex]], and released as a YouTube original series. The series consists of 12-minute long episodes, each telling a self-contained story about how humans use the [[EXOFRAME]], a type of basic [[mecha]] frame acquired from a mysterious alien race known as The Peddlers.

The first set of 6 episodes was released in December of 2019, and a second batch was released in December of 2020. Plastic [[model kit]]s based on the series' mecha are released under [[Goodsmile Company]]'s [[Moderoid]] line. The model kit line includes a [[crossover]] kit with [[Soukou Kihei VOTOMS]], which reimagines the iconic [[Scopedog]] as an EXOFRAME variant.

h4. External links
* "Official Site":[https://project-obsolete.com/en/]
* "Watch on YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKPsuBIKuejNJW_M6ArHpD6DBeMIw405L]

title: shoop_da_whoop
body:
A [[4chan]] meme started in 2006 from the [[Dragon Ball Z]] character [[Cell (dragon ball)|]] in blackface shouting “SHOOP DA WHOOP”, “IMMA CHARGIN MAH LAZER”, and/or “IMMA FIRIN MAH LAZER”, typically ending with the firing of said lazer. Though the origin is disputed, Encyclopedia Dramatica claims it to be a Flash animation called “Syntax Error #2”. The meme has been reproduced as both images, motivators and animations.

Noticeable from ""THE":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hSVNbxjdvv8] "LAZER":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQLKEZzBIZE] "COLLECTION":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d3ZYF-Zmo2E]" videos.

title: princess_laura
body: The princess of the kingdom of Alefgard in [[Dragon Quest]]. Her name is changed to [b]Gwaelin[/b] in the English localisation and [b]Lora[/b] in the Gameboy remake.

title: netflix_adaptation_(meme)
body:
Netflix Adaptation refers to images mocking [[Netflix]] adaptations of various anime and manga series by comparing the artwork to photographs of cosplayers, centering the joke on how the adaptations tend to change characters for the worse with poor design or fundamental plot changes.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/netflix-adaptation

title: shimoneta_to_iu_gainen_ga_sonzai_shinai_taikutsu_na_sekai
body:
[i]Shimoneta: A Boring World Where the Concept of Dirty Jokes Doesn’t Exist[/i]

Light novel series written by Akagi Hirotaka and illustrated by [[shimotsuki_eight|Shimotsuki Eito]]. Adapted into a 2014 manga and 2015 anime series.

In a dystopian future, Japanese authorities are cracking down on anyone caught using any risque language or distributing lewd materials in the country, to the point where all citizens are forced to wear high-tech chokers analyzing their every spoken word. A new high-school student named [[Okuma Tanukichi]] enters the country's leading elite "public morals school" to reunite with his crush and student council President, [[Anna Nishikinomiya]]. However, Tanukichi quickly finds himself entwined with the perverted terrorist "Blue Snow" when she kidnaps and forces him to join her organization, "SOX," in spreading semi-pornographic material across the city.

h4. Characters

* [[Okuma Tanukichi]]
* [[Kajou Ayame]]

* [[Anna Nishikinomiya]]
* [[Fuwa Hyouka]]
* [[Saotome Otome]]
* [[Binkan-chan]]
* [[Nuregoromo Yutori]]
* [[Annie Brown]]
other_names: 下ネタという概念が存在しない退屈な世界

title: has_science_gone_too_far?_(meme)
body:
Has Science Gone Too Far? is a series of parody advertisements for the website Officialquiz.com, which typically feature poorly photoshopped images challenging the viewer to determine whether the photo is "real" or "fake."

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/has-science-gone-too-far
